Articles.Content:
The Moreas Team is proud to present a medium size, medium range, high speed and high altitude Fighter Aircraft, inspired by the mighty Sukhoi SU-37. It'll go up to 20,000m at around 1500m/s and we have tree different variants, based on the weaponry equipped on each one.

This thing is highly manoeuvrable and flies quite good at low speeds, being seriously difficult to make it enter in a dangerous stall.

Here are the three variants:

The F/A 1A variant is equipped with three pairs of liquid fuel propelled air-ground bombs. As they have no control surfaces, nor they have thrust vectoring you can't guide them, but you can adjust the throttle to improve accuracy:

The F/A 1B version comes with four pairs of solid rocket (sepratron) propelled short range multi-purpose missiles. At long ranges they aren't what you'd call accurate, but up close they're pretty damn effective:

Lastly, the F/A 1C model carries under each wing three of the missiles of the B model plus one bomb from the A one:

Here's a video featuring the C version:

And here you can see all three of them escorting my Heavy Bomber

Controls:

A:

-1, 2 & 3: Drop the bombs (in pairs), starting by the ones on the most exterior part.

B:

-1, 2, 3 & 4: Fire the missiles (in pairs), starting by the ones on the most exterior part.

C:

-1: Drop the bombs.

-2, 3 & 4: Fire the missiles, starting by the lower ones.

You can get the crafts here Use at you own risk

Edited June 26, 2013 by MoreasGamin
Good job. I really like the weapons, the wing design, and what you have done with the lower fuselage.

Good job. I really like the weapons, the wing design, and what you have done with the lower fuselage.

Thanks! Seriously, the weapons were a pain to do, because radial decouplres don't work for that purpose and stack ones are a bit tricky to use radially... But there they are! With the wings I just aimed for a simple but yet manoeuvrable design...
You should spin-stabilize the missiles, it makes them MUCH more accurate!

You should spin-stabilize the missiles, it makes them MUCH more accurate!

Well... I hadn't thought of that, I'll try that out
